name: One Last Job
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Criminal]] enemies in play (to a maximum of 4).
[tablet]: -2 (-4 instead if there is a [[Criminal]] enemy at your location).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose 1 [[Criminal]] enemy discarded by this effect and spawn it engaged with you.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of [[Criminal]] enemies in play.
[tablet]: -3 (-5 instead if there is a [[Criminal]] enemy at your location).
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, discard the top 6 cards of the encounter deck. Choose 1 [[Criminal]] enemy discarded by this effect and spawn it engaged with you. It makes an immediate attack.

flavor:
The moon casts long shadows that reach across the ground like searching fingers.
You've always seen this city as home, but tonight Arkham feels like another place entirely.
name: Arkham Nightlife
text: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered from an [[Arkham]] location: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. One at a time, spawn each [[Criminal]] enemy discarded this way at the nearest empty location.
back_flavor:
Moving quickly down the avenue to your next destination, you see a suspicious-looking woman in a long coat step out from a nearby alley. You turn down a side street to avoid her and nearly run into a man with a wicked scar running down his right cheek. He takes a drag from his cigarette, tosses it to the sidewalk, and glowers at you. You step back only to bump into the woman you saw before. She smiles.
"Where you goin', pal? We just wanna talk."
back_text: Spawn 1 set-aside Gang Enforcer enemy engaged with the investigator with the most clues. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

flavor: Your every step is dogged by both the Sheldons and the O'Bannions. It seems like the two warring gangs have put aside their beef to end your investigation.
name: Long Night
text: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered from an [[Arkham]] location: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. One at a time, spawn each [[Criminal]] enemy discarded this way at the nearest empty location.
back_flavor:
No matter where you go, there seems to be a mobster waiting in every back alley, standing casually on the street corner, or watching from shop windows and park benches. It's too dangerous to continue your search, so you head back to Tillinghast's shop. A mob of gangsters intercepts you just a block away. The largest among them steps toward you menacingly, a lit cigarette clenched in his teeth, as his mooks restrain you.
"Didn't anyone ever tell you that curiosity killed the cat?" He leans down and puts his cigarette out on your cheek, then nods to his lackeys, who swiftly beat you down with brass knuckles, bare fists, and bricks.
Message received.
back_text: Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

flavor: You need to find out what happened to Tillinghast's shipment. With the increased gang activity all over Rivertown, you think that checking in with the Sheldons and the O'Bannions is the best place to start.
name: Questioning the Gangs
text: *This act gets +1 [per_investigator] clue threshold. [fast] Spend X clues: Parley. Discard an engaged [[Criminal]] enemy with X remaining health at your location. Place 1 clue (from the token pool) on this act. Objective - At the end of the round, if the number of clues on this act equals or exceeds its clue threshold, advance.

name: Hibb's Roadhouse
text: Easttown is connected to Hibb's Roadhouse. Revelation - Put Hibb's Roadhouse into play. Spawn the set-aside Sadie Sheldon enemy at Hibb's Roadhouse. Add the set-aside act 2a - "The Sheldon Gang" and act 3a - "Face the Music" to the act deck, then advance to act 2a.

flavor: You need to find out what happened to Tillinghast's shipment. With the increased gang activity all over Rivertown, you think that checking in with the Sheldons and the O'Bannions is the best place to start.
name: Questioning the Gangs
text: *This act gets +1 [per_investigator] clue threshold. [fast] Spend X clues: Parley. Discard an engaged [[Criminal]] enemy with X remaining health at your location. Place 1 clue (from the token pool) on this act. Objective - At the end of the round, if the number of clues on this act equals or exceeds its clue threshold, advance.

name: La Bella Luna
text: Downtown is connected to La Bella Luna. Revelation - Put La Bella Luna into play. Spawn the set-aside Naomi O'Bannion enemy at La Bella Luna. Add the set-aside act 2a - "The O'Bannion Gang" and act 3a - "Face the Music" to the act deck, then advance to act 2a.

flavor: The Sheldons wound up with the shipment. It's up to you to either talk Sadie into a deal, or "convince" her it's not worth the trouble.
name: The Sheldon Gang
text: Sadie Sheldon gains: "[action] Spend up to 4 resources: Parley. Test [willpower] or [combat] (5). This test gets -1 difficulty for each resource spent as part of this action's cost. For each point you succeed by, place 1 of your clues on Sadie Sheldon." Objective - When damage is placed on Sadie Sheldon, advance. Objective - If there are 3 clues on Sadie Sheldon, advance.
back_flavor:
Your negotiations are cut short as Naomi O'Bannion strides into Hibb's Roadhouse, accompanied by a pair of mobsters.
"That shipment is mine, Sadie" she says coldly. You duck down as her goons pull out their rifles and spray the walls and furniture with a hail of bullets.
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Naomi O'Bannion and Gang Enforcer enemies at Hibb's Roadhouse. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Gang Soldier and spawn it at Hibb's Roadhouse. If there is at least 1 clue on Sadie Sheldon, place 2 damage on Naomi O'Bannion. Move up to 2 clues from Sadie Sheldon to any non-[[Elite]], [[Criminal]] enemies at Hibb's Roadhouse. Each enemy with clues on it disengages from each investigator and gains aloof (while there are clues on it).

flavor: The O'Bannions nicked Tillinghast's shipment. It's up to you to either talk Naomi into a deal, or "convince" her it's not worth the trouble.
name: The O'Bannion Gang
text: Naomi O'Bannion gains: "[action] Spend up to 4 resources: Parley. Test [intellect] or [agility] (5). This test gets -1 difficulty for each resource spent as part of this action's cost. For each point you succeed by, place 1 of your clues on Naomi O'Bannion." Objective - When damage is placed on Naomi O'Bannion, advance. Objective - If there are 3 clues on Naomi O'Bannion, advance.
back_flavor: There is a sound of a struggle at the entrance to the swanky lounge, followed by a muffled scream. Sadie Sheldon bursts into La Bella Luna accompanied by several rough-and-tumble mooks. They crack their knuckles when they see you, and advance at Sheldon's signal.
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Sadie Sheldon and Gang Enforcer enemies at La Bella Luna. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Gang Soldier and spawn it at La Bella Luna. If there is at least 1 clue on Naomi O'Bannion, place 2 damage on Sadie Sheldon. Move up to 2 clues from Naomi O'Bannion to any non-[[Elite]], [[Criminal]] enemies at La Bella Luna. Each enemy with clues on it disengages from each investigator and gains aloof (while there are clues on it).

flavor: You've found yourself squarely in the center of a gang war!
name: Face the Music
text: Each [[Criminal]] enemy with clues on it gains aloof. [action] Remove 1 clue from a [[Criminal]] enemy at your location: Parley. That enemy deals its damage to another enemy at your location. Objective - When the round ends, if there is at least 1 [[Elite]] enemy in the victory display, advance.
back_flavor: As the conflict erupts into outright bloodshed, you locate a small crate labeled "Tillinghast Endeavors" in a back room. Keeping low to the ground, you scamper through the fight and back out to the cold evening air. The sound of shattering glass and heavy blows emanates from the building behind you. "Aw, applesauce," says a voice above you. A compact figure clad in black slides down a rappelling line and removes their mask. "I had a whole heist planned, you know. An informant. A calling card, even," Ruby says, tossing a yellow rose on the pavement. "I didn't think you could just walk in and ask politely, but, well, I guess you won fair and square."

name: Tillinghast Esoterica
text: Tillinghast Esoterica is connected to the location to the right of it, and vice versa. [action] Investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: In your Campaign Log, record the investigators discovered an alien language. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: "Tillinghast Esoterica - purveyor of sundry delights, exotic treasures, wondrous baubles, and innumerable secrets." - Recent ad in the Arkham Advertiser
back_text: Tillinghast Esoterica is connected to the location to the right of it, and vice versa.

name: Sadie Sheldon
text:
Retaliate.
Sadie Sheldon cannot move and gets +1 [per_investigator] health.
Sadie Sheldon gets +1 fight for each damage on her (to a maximum of +3 fight).

name: Naomi O'Bannion
text: Alert. Naomi O'Bannion cannot move and gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - The first time Naomi O'Bannion is evaded each round: Ready her. Any investigator at her location may take 1 damage to prevent this.

flavor: "Don't go stickin' your nose where it don't belong, pal!"
name: Gang Soldier
Gang Enforcer
text: Hunter. Prey - Most clues. Forced - The first time each round an investigator at this enemy's location attacks another [[Criminal]] enemy: Gang Enforcer readies and attacks that investigator.

name: Gang Informant
text: Aloof. Spawn - Nearest [[Arkham]] location with clues. Forced - After an investigator at Gang Informant's location discovers 1 or more clues while this enemy is ready: That investigator must either spend 3 resources or place 1 doom on the current agenda.

name: Caught in the Crossfire
text: Revelation - Put Caught in the Crossfire into play in your threat area. Forced - When damage is dealt to a [[Criminal]] enemy at your location: Test [intellect] or [agility] (3). If you fail, reduce the damage dealt to that enemy by 1 and take 1 direct damage. Discard Caught in the Crossfire.

name: End of Negotiations
text: Revelation - Attach End of Negotiations to the nearest [[Criminal]] enemy. Limit 1 per enemy. If you cannot, End of Negotiations gains surge. Forced - After an investigator parleys at this location: Attached enemy attacks that investigator. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard this card.

name: The Western Wall
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is your location's level.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail and your location is fully flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, increase the flood level of your location.
[elder_thing]: -3 (-5 instead if your location is fully flooded).
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 2 more than your location's level.
[cultist]: -5. If your location is fully flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -5. Increase the flood level of your location, if able.
[elder_thing]: -5 (If your location is fully flooded, you automatically fail instead).

flavor: You can navigate a path through the crumbling ruins via small pockets of air.
name: Flooded Paths
text: Each location is connected to each other location on the rows above and below it. Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location or decrease the flood level of your current location, take 5 direct damage.
back_flavor: One wrong step sends you careening away from the ruined wall. As you look out into the abyssal darkness of the ocean depths, you have the illusion of drifting in the vastness of space. It is utterly serene. A sharp tug pulls your attention away: your line is caught on a falling chunk of foundation. Another sharp tug follows. You are drawn back to safety, but not without a heavy bruise and some wounded pride.
back_text: Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma.

flavor: A softly pulsing light at the base of the ancient foundations beckons you to the sea floor. You must proceed carefully.
name: Descend into the Abyss
text: [fast] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease your location's flood level. Objective – Make your way to the sea floor! If each surviving investigator is at Obsidian Foundations, you may advance.
back_flavor: Andy Van Nortwick is the last to tumble into the ring of black columns at the base of the city. He looks out in awe at a shimmering energy field in the center of the underwater plaza. The field ripples around the columns like a persistent bubble, creating a pocket of breathable air. A long meandering tunnel winds from your position to the entrance of the underwater dome. You have reached the sea floor at last.

flavor: It is a steep climb up the crumbling wall, but if you step carefully, you should reach the surface in one piece.
name: Ascend the Wall
text: [fast] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease your location's flood level. Objective – Make your way to the surface! If each surviving investigator is at Western Wall, you may advance.
back_flavor: Ruby helps you up the slick black rocks to stand on the edge of what was once an ancient walkway. R'lyeh has risen noticeably since you arrived: the sunken western wall tower precariously over the turgid waters like an ancient citadel. The bay where you first made camp has receded as well. Not far off, you can see the Cassandra bob on the black waves. It won't be a long trek back to where you made landfall.

name: Treacherous Path
text: X is this location's level. Forced - After you enter Treacherous Path from a location above it: Take 1 damage. Forced - After you enter Treacherous Path from a location below it: Take 1 horror.
back_flavor: The path is both perilous and breathtaking in equal measure. A brilliant green glow emanates from below, illuminating schools of fish and deep sea creatures.
back_text: You cannot enter Treacherous Path if there are clues on your location.

name: Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w]
text: Revelation - Attach Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w] to your location. Cannot be canceled. Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w] cannot leave play. [action]: Test [combat] (2), then test [willpower] (2). If you succeed at both tests, flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Seafloor Frieze [tdc_rune_w]
text:
Below the frieze is a triptych of three distinct scenes. The first panel depicts a comet falling from the sky. The center panel, while highly abstract, shows legions of nightmarish alien shapes pouring out of fallen rocks. Their faces are covered in thick, ropy appendages. The frieze depicts the alien creatures trampling a forest of what looks like thick, boxy flowering trees. The final frieze depicts a wave of sinewy, wormlike creatures spilling out from the celestial rocks like a flood.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_w] In your Campaign Log, record "Parasite" under [tdc_rune_w] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

flavor: [tdc_rune_j][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_x][tdc_rune_p][tdc_rune_z] · [tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_k] · [tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_f][tdc_rune_u][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_f][tdc_rune_c] · [tdc_rune_u][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_h] · [tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_f][tdc_rune_z] · [tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_l] · [tdc_rune_q][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_s][tdc_rune_a][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_u][tdc_rune_c] · [tdc_rune_l][tdc_rune_h][tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_s][tdc_rune_h]
name: Undersea Vault [tdc_rune_z]
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (X), where X is this location's level. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve its text.

name: The Undersea Vault [tdc_rune_z]
text:
You press three small hidden nodes inset into the vault door and it slides open with a satisfying hiss. Inside is a desiccated corpse of an alien creature, its octopoid face and leathery wings reduced to dust. It holds an obsidian slate in one bony hand; you identify it as a kind of city map, likely of R'lyeh itself.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_z] In your Campaign Log, record "City" under [tdc_rune_z] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Flip this card back to its location side. It cannot be flipped over again.

name: Deep One Matron
text: Hunter. Spawn - Any revealed location (Drowned Shanty, if able). Forced - When Deep One Matron enters play: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Deep One]] enemy and spawn it at this location.

name: "Look Out!"
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, put "Look Out!" into play in your threat area. Forced - The first time you enter a flooded location each round: Take 1 horror. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard "Look Out!"

name: Hunting Parasite
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Bearer only. Spawn - A connecting location (empty if able). Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Place 1 doom on a player card at this enemy's location. Then, discard Hunting Parasite.

name: The Drowned Quarter
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of revealed locations (rounded down).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail and your location is fully flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -3 (-5 instead if your location is not flooded).
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of revealed locations.
[cultist]: -3. If your location is flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -4. For each point you fail by, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -4 (-6 instead if your location is not flooded).

flavor: Chunks of R'lyeh's foundation continue to fall, threatening the seafloor dome.
name: The Sunken Ruins
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location or decrease the flood level of your current location, take 5 direct damage.

name: Seafloor Leviathan
text: Massive. Patrol (nearest unflooded or partially flooded location). Spawn - Barrier Core. Seafloor Leviathan gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Forced - When the enemy phase begins, if this enemy is ready: Increase the flood level of its location.

flavor: The dome won't hold up much longer against the barrage of falling rock.
name: Collapsing Dome
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location or decrease the flood level of your current location, take 5 direct damage.
back_flavor: "The dome could burst at any second. We have to get out!" one of your expedition mates shouts, pointing to the sputtering energy field. You and the other expedition members sustain extensive injuries in your escape. You've just barely reached the entrance when you hear a loud crash. The shimmering energy field bursts like a bubble as the ocean finally overwhelms the ancient dome.
back_text: Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

flavor: You can't open the barrier core until the undersea dome is at least partially drained.
name: Reactivate the Core
text: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it. [fast] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease your location's flood level. Objective – At the end of the round, if each surviving investigator is at Barrier Core (Active), you may advance. (Hint: Reactivate the Barrier Core by revealing and draining locations!)
back_text:
If an investigator controls the Barrier Node:
The strange orb sends a ripple of energy throughout the orrery and the surrounding dome. By pulling the node free, you have stolen the only thing powering the dome. A tremor shakes the structure as the energy field up above begins to dissipate!
(→R1) (page 18).
Otherwise:
The alien machinery hums with an otherworldly current. Overhead, a massive chunk of rock falls from the foundation and passes through the flickering energy field. The structure seems to have been stabilized.
(→R2) (page 18)

name: Barrier Core
text: Forced - If 6 or more [[Seafloor]] locations are revealed and not flooded: Flip Barrier Core. [action] Decrease the flood level of Barrier Core and choose an adjacent eligible location: Increase the flood level of the chosen location. Then, place 3 [per_investigator] clues on it. (Group limit once per round.)

name: Barrier Core
text: Forced - If there are 5 or fewer unflooded [[Seafloor]] locations: Flip Barrier Core. [action] Spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the set-aside Barrier Node story asset into play under your control.

flavor: The seafloor trench feels as alien as another dimension.
name: Abyssal Trench
text:
X is equal to half of the number of revealed [[Seafloor]] locations (rounded down).
[reaction] After you successfully fight or evade an enemy at Abyssal Trench: Decrease its flood level. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Drowned Acropolis
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Drowned Acropolis: You must either increase its flood level or take 1 horror. [action] Increase the flood level of Drowned Acropolis: Choose any location and decrease its flood level. (Group limit twice per game.)
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Drowned Acropolis
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Drowned Acropolis: You must either increase the flood level of an adjacent location or take 1 damage. [action] Increase the flood level of Drowned Acropolis: Choose any location and decrease its flood level. (Group limit twice per game.)
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Blasted Ruins
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Blasted Ruins: Increase its flood level. [action] Investigators at Blasted Ruins spend 5 resources, as a group: Decrease the flood level of this location or an adjacent location. (Group limit once per round.)
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Blasted Ruins
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Blasted Ruins: Increase its flood level. [action] Investigators at Blasted Ruins discard a total of 1 [per_investigator] cards from hand, as a group: Decrease the flood level of this location or an adjacent location. (Group limit once per round.)
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Coral Reef
text: [action] [action]: Draw 2 cards and gain 2 resources. Spawn the set-aside Undersea Parasite [tdc_rune_x] enemy at this location. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Coral Reef
text: Forced - After Coral Reef is revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and spawn it at this location. [reaction] After you discover 1 or more clues at Coral Reef: Spawn the set-aside Undersea Parasite [tdc_rune_x] enemy at this location.
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Ancient Gallery
text: [action] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Put the set-aside Obsidian Relic [tdc_rune_y] asset into play under your control. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: The undersea plaza is filled with all manner of statues, alien laboratories, and places of learning.
back_text: Forced - When you enter Sea Floor: Increase the flood level of this location and an adjacent eligible location.

name: Undersea Parasite [tdc_rune_x]
text: Aloof. Retaliate. Forced - After Undersea Parasite [tdc_rune_x] attacks you: Flip this card and resolve its text. Forced - When Undersea Parasite [tdc_rune_x] would leave play: Flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Undersea Parasite [tdc_rune_x]
text:
If this card flipped because Undersea Parasite [tdc_rune_x] attacked you, read the following:
The creature's bite burns like fire. Before you can react, it has vanished into a maze of coral.
Flip this card and move it to a connecting location (with no investigators, if able). Otherwise:
After crushing the loathsome creature's carapace, you catch a glint of something. An alien symbol?
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_x] In your Campaign Log, record "Sum" under [tdc_rune_x] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Obsidian Relic [tdc_rune_y]
text:
If Obsidian Relic [tdc_rune_y] would leave play, remove it from the game.
[action]: Test [intellect] (8). Double the skill icons of each card committed to this skill test. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Obsidian Relic [tdc_rune_y]
text:
Pressing a small inset in the relic's base opens the statue's center with a strange hiss, unfolding like an obsidian blossom. A light projection extends over the relic's open core, showing hazy scenes of a crashing alien shoreline and nameless horrors silhouetted against the sky. A cnidarian creature looms over a crowd of squamous larvae, grasping a glowing tablet in a tangle of viscous tentacles. Was this some kind of otherworldly sage? An alien leader, perhaps?
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_y] In your Campaign Log, record "Knowledge" under [tdc_rune_y] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

flavor: Not your average jellyfish.
name: Medusa
text: Aloof. Patrol (nearest unflooded or partially flooded location). Forced - When the enemy phase begins, if Medusa is ready: Increase the flood level of its location. If you cannot, place 1 doom on Medusa.

name: Barrier Node
text:
Barrier Node cannot be defeated or leave play.
[reaction] When your turn begins: Heal 1 damage from Barrier Node.
[tdc_rune_q] · [tdc_rune_x] · [tdc_rune_g] · [tdc_rune_k] · [tdc_rune_s]
Barrier Node gets +2 health.

name: The Apiary
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the amount of doom on enemies and assets in play, rounded down (to a max of 4).
[cultist]: -1. If there is a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on an enemy at your location with no doom on it.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, take 1 damage or 1 horror.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the amount of doom on enemies and assets in play (to a max of 8).
[cultist]: -3. If there is a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -5. If you fail, place 1 doom on an enemy at your location (with no doom on it, if able).
[elder_thing]: -6. If you fail, take 1 damage or 1 horror.

flavor: You can hear the sound of slithering and gnashing teeth in the darkness. Something awful stirs in the bowels of R'lyeh. You would rather not stick around to find out what it actually is...
name: Stirring in the Dark
back_flavor: The tunnels branch and merge like blood vessels in a vast alien gullet. Every surface is covered in fleshy organic growths. What you first thought were tremors were the tunnels themselves: tightening and expanding like the muscles of a large trachea. As you round a corner, you see a nightmarish creature with sightless, buggy eyes slither out of sight.
back_text: Place clues on each location without victory X up to its clue value. Shuffle the set-aside Grotesque Amalgam enemy with the encounter discard pile and place those cards on the bottom of the encounter deck.

flavor: Loathsome creatures emerge from every nook and cranny. If you don't escape soon, you have a feeling you'll become a permanent resident.
name: Loathsome Parasites
text: Forced - When doom is placed on this agenda, if there are no non-[[Elite]] enemies in play: Reveal cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed and spawn it (at an empty location, if able). Shuffle each other revealed card and place them on top of the encounter deck.
back_flavor: A horde of stinking pustulous creatures chases you into a dark culvert. You hide within a fleshy fold of wall and hope for the best. After what feels like hours, the halls grow silent. Breathing a sigh of relief, you try to push the fold back only to find it has latched onto your arm with a sticky, gluey substance. As you try to pull away from it, the skin on your hand and arm sloughs off loosely, and with little pain. You stare in horror at your degloved palm. An orange tendril snakes past your ear to encircle your neck. You are being digested alive.
back_text: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

flavor: The fleshy tunnels excrete a foul, waxy substance that burns the skin. Your destination lies deeper within the disgusting labyrinth.
name: Unsettling Signs
text: [action] Spend 1 or more clues, as a group: For each clue spent, discard the top 5 cards (10 cards instead if there is 1 investigator) of the encounter deck and draw each location discarded by this effect. Objective - If each surviving investigator is at a [[Sanctum]] location, investigators may spend the requisite clues, as a group, to advance.(Hint: you may not be able to explore further after you advance.)
back_text:
If each investigator is at Lost Campsite:
After searching the campsite, you find yourselves surrounded by robed figures holding torches, but no weapons. A soft-faced woman in a patchwork cloak emerges from the crowd. "Please, don't be alarmed. We have no intention of harming you."
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Proceed to Interlude: Lost Pilgrims (page 21).
If each investigator is at Acidic Coelom:
You hear a hiss, then feel sharp, stinging pain in your back. As you lose consciousness, look around and see a prehensile limb buried in your spine.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Proceed to Interlude: The Hive Mind (page 22).

flavor: The campsite is under attack by alien parasites!
name: Lost Pilgrims
text: Each [[Cultist]] enemy gains victory 0 and aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) or [combat] (2). For each point you succeed by, move a different [[Cultist]] enemy at your location once in any direction. Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Each [[Cultist]] enemy takes 1 damage for each [[Stowaway]] enemy at its location. Objective - When the round ends, if there is a combined total of 5 or more [[Cultist]] cards in the victory display and/or under this act, you must advance.
back_text:
If there are 3 or more Cultist cards under this act:
The tunnels buckle and spasm as you flee the apiary. You usher the last of the surviving pilgrims out as the alien parasites screech in primal rage behind you. You are safe... for now.
(→R1) (page 23).
Otherwise:
The tunnels buckle and spasm as you flee the apiary. You hear the pilgrims' agonized screams behind you. Suddenly the screams stop, replaced by the sound of gnashing mouths and tearing flesh. You were one of the fortunate ones.
(→R2) (page 23).

flavor: It doesn't live in the walls! It is the walls!
name: The Hive Mind
text: [fast] During your turn, place X clues on your location: Deal X damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Forced - When the round ends: Flip a coin. On heads, rotate Central Chamber once clockwise. On tails, rotate Central Chamber once counter-clockwise. Objective - If Mother is defeated, immediately advance.
back_flavor: "Hey, ugly! Eat this!" Ruby shouts as she empties her pistol into the Mother's sagging flesh. The queen parasite screams in pain. Around you, the other stowaways chitter and squeal in tandem, then go limp as their mother expires. Ruby's face is wild as she stomps each of the parasites in turn, just to make sure they're dead. You examine the creatures' remains. Without the Mother to control them, the parasites are inert.

name: Apiary Entrance
text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Shuffle each location in the encounter discard pile into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck. [fast]: Choose the farthest location from Apiary Entrance. Place clues on the chosen location up to its clue value. (Limit once per round.) [action]: Resign. You make your exit.

name: Apiary Entrance
text: When a [[Stowaway]] enemy is drawn, spawn it at Apiary Entrance instead of its normal spawn location. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place a [[Cultist]] asset or enemy at this location underneath the act. [action]: Resign. You make your exit.

name: Fleshy Paths
text: Revelation - Put Fleshy Paths into play. [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to search the flesh-like walls. If you succeed, put the set-aside Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s] asset into play under your control.

name: Fleshy Paths [tdc_rune_r]
text: Revelation - Put Fleshy Paths [tdc_rune_r] into play. [action] You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_r] In your Campaign Log, record "Time" under [tdc_rune_r] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

name: Growing Fields
text: Revelation - Put Growing Fields into play along with the set-aside Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u] location. [action]: Test [willpower] (8). Double the skill icons of each card committed to this test. If you succeed, take control of the set-aside Grisly "Mask" story asset.

name: Churning Chasm
text: Revelation - Put Churning Chasm into play and spawn the set-aside Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t] enemy at it. [reaction] When you begin your turn in Churning Chasm: Move to any revealed location.

name: Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q]
text: Revelation - Put Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q] into play. [action][action]: You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_q] In your Campaign Log, record "Hand" under [tdc_rune_q] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

name: Luminous Tunnels
text: Revelation - Put Luminous Tunnels into play. Shuffle the set-aside Pilgrims encounter set into the encounter deck along with the encounter discard pile. Find the set-aside Spawning Grounds and Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q] and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck. [action] Take 1 damage: Place clues on the location farthest from Apiary Entrance up to its clue value.

name: Spawning Grounds
text: Revelation - Put Spawning Grounds into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Find the set-aside Lost Campsite and Churning Chasm and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck.

flavor: The camp is seemingly abandoned, strewn with dishware and tattered tents. Perhaps there are survivors hiding nearby.
name: Lost Campsite
text: Revelation - Put Lost Campsite into play. [action]: Draw the topmost card beneath Lost Campsite.

name: Maria Rivera
text: When damage would be placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location, place it on Maria Rivera instead. [reaction] When doom would be placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy, exhaust Maria Rivera: Place it on Maria Rivera instead, as damage. Forced - If Maria Rivera is defeated: Add her to the victory display.

name: Grasping Corridor
text: Revelation - Put Grasping Corridor into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Find the set-aside Starving Corridor and Corrupted Vault [tdc_rune_q] and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck. [action] Take 1 horror: Place clues on the location farthest from Apiary Entrance up to its clue value.

name: Starving Corridor
text: Revelation - Put Starving Corridor into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Find the set-aside Acidic Coelom and Churning Chasm and shuffle them into the bottom 10 cards of the encounter deck.

flavor: The acidic vapors digest anything inside the chamber, including flesh and metal.
name: Acidic Coelom
text: Revelation - Put Acidic Coelom into play. As an additional cost to move from Acidic Coelom to Apiary Entrance, you must take 1 damage.

name: Central Chamber
text: Central Chamber is connected to the location below it (bordering its bottom edge) and vice versa. Forced - When your turn ends, if you are at this location: Test [agility] (1). If you fail, you must either move to a connecting location or Mother attacks you.
back_flavor: A rhythmic thud reverberates through the walls of the chamber like a heartbeat.
back_text: Central Chamber is connected to the location below it (bordering its bottom edge) and vice versa.

name: Mother
text: Massive. Relentless. Forced - When another [[Stowaway]] enemy is defeated: Move all damage on that enemy to Mother. (If that enemy had doom on it, shuffle that enemy into the encounter deck as well.)

name: Grotesque Amalgam
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After you fight this enemy using a [[Weapon]] asset: Place 1 doom on that asset.

name: Apiary Tender
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Forced - When doom is placed on a card at this location: Ready Apiary Tender. It loses aloof until the end of the round. If it is engaged with an investigator, it makes an immediate attack.

name: Hungry Walls
text: Revelation - Attach this card to your location. Forced - When you leave attached location: Test [agility] (4) or [combat] (4). If you fail and you tested... - ...[agility], discard an asset you control and take 1 damage. Discard Hungry Walls. - ...[combat], take 2 direct damage. Discard Hungry Walls.

name: Dangerous Curiosity
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is your location's shroud value. If you fail, take 1 damage and discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Stowaway]] enemy is discarded and draw it. Shuffle each location discarded by this effect back into the encounter deck.

flavor: What is that moving inside?
name: Alien Eggs
text: Surge. Revelation - Place 1 doom on the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy with no doom on it.

name: Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u]
text: Forced - After Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u] enters play: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it at this location. [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u] by 2 or more: Flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Hidden Vault [tdc_rune_u]
text:
You find an alien panel hidden behind a fold of fleshy wall. Grimacing, you press it and reveal a round alcove untouched by the alien growths. Sharp glowing symbols connected by curling lines appear on a black slate in the center of the alcove. After some study, you recognize it as some kind of ancestral tree. There are hundreds upon hundreds of names: how many creatures lived in this city aeons ago?
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_u] In your Campaign Log, record "Daughters" under [tdc_rune_u] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Flip this card back to its location side. It cannot be flipped over again.

name: Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t]
text: Retaliate. If Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t] would leave play, set it aside, out of play. Forced - When you defeat Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t]: Flip this enemy and resolve its text.

name: Squamous Parasite [tdc_rune_t]
text:
The alien creature's hard carapace crumbles to reveal a shining black sigil. It must have devoured this piece of technology... or was it assembled from it? Pressing the sigil projects an image of a cloudy golden sky. Somewhere not of this world. A series of glyphs and descending lines overlay the scene. Eventually, their meaning becomes clear.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_t] In your Campaign Log, record "Air" under [tdc_rune_t] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s]
text: If Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s] would leave play, set it aside, out of play. Forced - After you take 1 or more damage: Deal 1 damage to Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s]. [reaction] When you end the game with Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s] under your control: Flip this card and resolve its text.

name: Ancient Relic [tdc_rune_s]
text:
Twisting portions of the relic unlocks a small cylinder in the center. Inside the cylinder is an even smaller version of the same relic, and within the smaller relic is a glittering gem. Holding it up to the light projects a series of small dots that form some kind of code. One of the expedition members identifies it as a blueprint of sorts: the symbols appear to be instructions for repairing some kind of machine.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_s] In your Campaign Log, record "Machine" under [tdc_rune_s] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Grisly "Mask"
text:
[fast] Exhaust Grisly "Mask": Disengage from each enemy. Until the beginning of your next turn, you cannot move and cannot damage enemies or engage them.
[tdc_rune_j] · [tdc_rune_m] · [tdc_rune_s] · [tdc_rune_c] · [tdc_rune_b]
[fast] Take 1 direct horror and exhaust Grisly "Mask": Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location.

name: Parasitic Transformation
text: Revelation - Put Parasitic Transformation into play in your threat area. Forced - After an enemy engages you: Place 1 doom on Parasitic Transformation. [action][action]: Discard Parasitic Transformation.

name: The Grand Vault
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of activated locations (rounded down).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, you must either deactivate your location or take 1 damage or 1 horror.
[tablet]: -2 (-3 instead if your location is partially flooded; -4 instead if your location is fully flooded).
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, search the encounter discard pile for a copy of the Still Behind You treachery and add it to the victory display.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of activated locations.
[cultist]: -4. After this test resolves, you must either deactivate your location or take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[tablet]: -3 (-4 instead if your location is partially flooded; -5 instead if your location is fully flooded).
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, search the encounter discard pile for a copy of the Still Behind You treachery and draw it.

flavor: The oppressive darkness is filled with the sound of crushing, gnashing machinery.
name: Bowels of the City
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter a partially flooded or unflooded location during your turn, or decrease your location's flood level, take 5 direct damage.
back_flavor: As you begin to make sense of the ever-shifting complex of maze-like corridors and chambers, a crack appears in one wall. The crack grows wider as two massive clawed hands push a hidden door open. A familiar imposing frame emerges from the darkness, glowering at you. Your tireless pursuer is here yet again.
back_text:
Spawn the set-aside The Inescapable enemy at the lead investigator's location. Choose an investigator at that location to test [agility] (4). If they succeed, disengage The Inescapable from each investigator and exhaust it.
Shuffle each copy of the set-aside Still Behind You treachery and 1 random set-aside [[Star Spawn]] enemy, along with the encounter deck and discard pile, into the encounter deck.

flavor: This thing won't stop unless you find a way to put it down for good.
name: Devil in the Machine
text: The Inescapable gets +1 [per_investigator] health. When The Inescapable moves via its hunter keyword, each location is considered to be connected to each adjacent location. Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter a partially flooded or unflooded location during your turn, or decrease your location's flood level, take 5 direct damage.
back_flavor: The incessant cacophony makes it difficult to hear anything, even the sound of your pursuer's footfalls. He could be lurking around any corner. It is only a matter of time before you are found.
back_text:
Search all in- and out-of-play areas for each copy of the Still Behind You treachery. Shuffle these cards, the set-aside [[Star Spawn]] enemy, and the encounter discard pile, into the encounter deck.
Move each unengaged Persistent Construct enemy in play to the Moving Platform, exhausted and unengaged.
If The Inescapable is in play, heal 1 [per_investigator] damage from it and move it once toward the nearest investigator. Each location is considered to be connected to each adjacent location during this movement.

flavor: With great effort and no small amount of luck, you may still be able to escape.
name: Devil in the Machine
text: The Inescapable gets +2 [per_investigator] health. When The Inescapable moves via its hunter keyword, each location is considered to be connected to each adjacent location. Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter a partially flooded or unflooded location during your turn, or decrease your location's flood level, take 5 direct damage.
back_flavor: You find yourself trapped in a small cubic room. Dark water pours out of ancient sluices, rising to your waist, then chest, then neck. Your very bones seem to vibrate with the unceasing thrum of the heart of the city. Pushing panic aside, you press glowing nodes and panels in a futile attempt to drain the chamber, but to no result. Gulping a few last breaths, you dive down, searching for any way out. You just barely squeeze through a massive sluice, struggling against the current. At long last, you tumble out into a deep reservoir filled with icy black water. Below you, the silhouettes of star spawn swim slowly, inexorably toward you. They move without haste, for they know that there is no rush: you have no escape.
back_text: Each surviving investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

flavor: The machinery that serves as the beating heart of R'lyeh is alien in design, but not inscrutable. Thanks to all you've learned up to this point, you may be able to find your way through.
name: Careful Navigation
text: [reaction] After the investigators have translated any 3 of the following glyphs ([tdc_rune_l], [tdc_rune_m], [tdc_rune_n], [tdc_rune_p], [tdc_rune_o]): Reveal the Sealed Chamber location. (Hint: Each of these glyphs are found in this scenario.). Objective - When the round ends, if an investigator controls the Tidal Tablet story asset, advance.
back_flavor:
With an undeniable sense of triumph, you pry the tablet from its resting place in the center of the chamber. It pulses in your hands in time to the thrumming machinery, sending ripples through the shallow water at your feet. Small tendrils of water snake upward to hang, suspended, around you. You wave the tablet once and watch the water on the floor rise and crash against the right wall of the chamber.
Satisfied with your find, you prepare to leave. However, you wonder if there are any other mysteries you have yet to uncover at the very heart of R'lyeh...
back_text: Increase the flood level of each location that can have its flood level increased. Place clues on each revealed [[Vault]] location without victory X up to its clue threshold.

flavor: There is only one way in and one way out of the ancient vault, but your route back is fraught with danger. Frothing water continues to pour in, carried by the great waterworks from the rest of the city.
name: Back Through the Machine
text: Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.
back_flavor: At long last, you reach the exit. After a short climb, you return to the towering precipice overlooking the ancient vault. There, you are surprised to find the other half of the expedition camped on the overlook, staring down at the churning machinery and turgid waters. Rather than press on, you and the others resolve to rest and share your findings as a group.
back_text: Check your Campaign log. - If the expedition headed west, (→R1) (page 27). - If the expedition headed east, (→R2) (page 27).

name: The Great Stair
text: The Great Stair cannot be flooded. [action]: Resign. You venture into darkness, leaving the churning machinery behind.
back_flavor: The stone stairwell appears to be the main way to access much of the eastern side of the city. It is engulfed in darkness, but the walls and steps vibrate with the constant movement of immense machines hidden just beyond the walls.

name: Moving Platform
text:
Moving Platform cannot be flooded.
Moving Platform is connected to each adjacent location, and vice versa.
[fast] Investigators at Moving Platform spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Swap Moving Platform with an adjacent [[Vault]] location.
back_flavor: The platform floats near the ceiling of a massive chamber beneath the city of R'lyeh. Your flashlights barely illuminate the series of individual rooms and halls below.
back_text:
Moving Platform cannot be flooded.
Moving Platform is connected to each adjacent location, and vice versa.

name: Core of the Vault
text: Core of the Vault cannot be flooded. Forced - If The Inescapable is defeated at this location: Search all in- and out-of-play areas for each copy of Still Behind You and remove them from the game. In your Campaign Log, record the creature was defeated. [action] [action] Spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: You study the machine. Proceed to Scenario Interlude: The Vault Core (page 26).
back_flavor: The heart of the great vault is a massive, sealed chamber filled with alien glyphs and bizarre machinery.
back_text: Core of the Vault cannot be flooded and investigators cannot move into it. Forced - At the end of the round, if each [[Vault]] location has been activated: Reveal Core of the Vault.

name: Shrouded Cistern
text: This location's flood level cannot be decreased. Forced - After Shrouded Cistern is revealed: Increase its flood level. [action]: You open up a new passageway. Activate this location. Then, increase the flood level of any eligible [[Vault]] location.
back_flavor:
"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

name: Chamber of Records [tdc_rune_l]
text:
[action]: Activate this location.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from this location, you discover this glyph:
[tdc_rune_l]
In your Campaign Log, record "Arm" under [tdc_rune_l] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.
back_flavor:
"One could not be sure that the sea and the ground were horizontal, hence the relative position of everything else seemed phantasmally variable."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
