name: Chamber of the Tablet
text:
Chamber of the Tablet cannot be flooded.
Chamber of the Tablet is connected to the location to the left of it, and vice versa.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from Chamber of the Tablet: Choose an investigator at this location to take control of the set-aside Tidal Tablet story asset.
back_flavor: The locks on the door to this chamber glow with four different alien symbols. Pressing your ear to the metal, the constant drone of the vault machinery melts away, and you hear the faintest sounds of crashing waves beyond the door.
back_text:
Sealed Chamber cannot be flooded.
Investigators cannot enter Sealed Chamber.

name: Slitherer in Darkness
text: Spawn - Nearest flooded location. Slitherer in Darkness cannot enter unflooded locations. Forced - When the enemy phase begins, if there are no investigators at this enemy's location: This enemy attacks the investigator with the lowest [combat] at a connecting location. If no attack was made, Slitherer in Darkness moves to the flooded location nearest the Moving Platform.

name: Vault Attendant
text: Hunter. Spawn - Engaged with prey. Prey - Most clues. When Vault Attendant moves via its hunter keyword, its location is considered to be connected to each activated location.

name: Deadly Mechanisms
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must decide (choose one; choose two instead if it is act 2): - Deactivate the nearest activated [[Vault]] location. - Draw 1 of the set-aside Vault Attendant enemies. - Move to an adjacent location (flooded if able).

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_o]
text: Revelation - Attach Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_o] to your location. Cannot be canceled. [action] Choose and discard assets from your play area with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the shroud value of attached location: Flip this card over and resolve its text.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_o]
text:
A small switch at the base of the wall opens into a cramped musty room. As you enter, a small glyph in the floor begins to glow a dim green. The light intensifies until it is blindingly bright, and the air in the room begins to crackle with energy. The glyph flares even brighter, then goes dark. The symbol's meaning will forever be burned into your memory.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_o] In your Campaign Log, record "Power" under [tdc_rune_o] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_n]
text: Revelation - Attach Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_n] to your location. Cannot be canceled. [action] Take a combined total of X damage and/or horror, where X is attached location's shroud: Flip this card over.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_n]
text:
Within the ancient vault is a large octagonal room that resembles a kind of laboratory. A central console resembles a clawed hand, with two of its "fingers" raised. Nodes in the console project a glowing translucent letter. Curious, you press one hand to a central node. A vision overwhelmes your mind: a torrential wave, a sundered mountain, burning forests and atmosphere. You pull one hand away, uncertain of what you just experienced. A record? A vision?
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_n] In your Campaign Log, record "Doom" under [tdc_rune_n] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_p]
text: Revelation - Attach Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_p] to your location. Cannot be canceled. [action] Choose and discard X cards from your hand, where X is attached location's shroud: Flip this card over.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_p]
text:
The room within the vault is dark and featureless, save for an incandescent, smoky orb suspended in the center. Inspecting it closer, you find a full-scale model of an alien planet. Small storm systems move along the surface at an accelerated rate, swirling and dissipating in seconds. When you touch it, your senses are assailed by invisible gales, torrential rain, and a crack of thunder. Lines of swirling alien writing appear on the globe, conveying a record of an ancient storm.
You discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_p] In your Campaign Log, record "Weather" under [tdc_rune_p] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Tidal Tablet
text:
[reaction] When your location's flood level is increased: Move to a connecting location.
[tdc_rune_l] · [tdc_rune_k] · [tdc_rune_d]
[fast] Exhaust Tidal Tablet: Increase the flood level of your location. Then, choose another flooded location and decrease its flood level.

name: Court of the Ancients
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Glyph]] cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: -2 (-4 instead if there is a [[Stowaway]] enemy at your location).
[tablet]: -2. If your location is flooded, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -4. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt, take 1 damage or 1 horror.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of [[Glyph]] cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3 (-5 instead if there is a [[Stowaway]] enemy at your location).
[tablet]: -3. If your location is flooded, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -5. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

flavor: The massive tower rises above you, promising enticing knowledge and forbidden truths. However, the imminent peril of navigating the ancient, crumbling structure comes into sharp focus as a chunk of obsidian crashes down nearby. For all its grandeur, you are not safe here.
name: Ruined Archives
back_flavor: As supernatural winds howl outside, the tower groans and sways like an ancient tree weathering a storm. You steady yourself against a pillar, hoping to wait out the tremor. Suddenly, you feel the pillar loosen. Stepping away, you watch the intricately carved pillar tumble down to the bottom far below.
back_text: Shuffle each [[Omen]] and [[Glyph]] card in the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

flavor: The massive tower promises enticing knowledge and forbidden truths. However, the imminent peril of navigating the ancient, crumbling structure comes into sharp focus as a chunk of obsidian crashes down to the flooded depths below. For all its grandeur, you are not safe here.
name: Flooded Archives
text: Forced - When your turn begins, if your location is fully flooded, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
back_flavor: As supernatural winds howl outside, the tower groans and sways like an ancient tree weathering a storm. You steady yourself against a pillar, hoping to wait out the tremor. Suddenly, you feel the pillar loosen. Stepping away, you watch the intricately carved pillar tumble down to the bottom far below. You pause, waiting to hear a splash, but there is none. The water below has receded. The city continues to rise like a long-dead corpse from the sea depths.
back_text:
Decrease the flood level of each location.
Shuffle each [[Omen]] and [[Glyph]] card in the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

flavor: The tower groans as R'lyeh continues its slow ascent from the depths of the ocean.
name: Unstable Foundations
text: During the enemy phase, each location is considered to be connected to the location above and below it. Forced - After the Great Lift moves: Each investigator at the Great Lift must test [agility] (2). Each investigator who fails takes 1 damage.
back_flavor: The tower shudders as all of R'lyeh continues to ascend. Ancient symbols on the court walls flash with blinding bright intensity. In your momentary blindness, you catch glimpses of blasphemous, hulking shapes of ancient creatures on what looks like a familiar black-sanded beach. An emerald sun reflects on oily black water of a distant alien shore. Every fiber of your being screams in protest as the sheer volume of history within the tower surges into your pitifully small mind all at once. Before you know it, you collapse on the stone floor and slip into a dark and restless slumber...
back_text: Each surviving investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma.

flavor: The halls and tall ceilings are divided into massive stacks, like the shelves of a library. There is so much you could learn here.
name: Steps of Giants
text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (8 cards instead if there is only 1 investigator). Draw 1 [[Glyph]] card discarded by this effect. Then, one at a time, draw each [[Omen]] card discarded by this effect. Objective - After the Great Lift flips to its (Active) side, immediately advance.
back_flavor: Ancient gears, unused for millennia, grind to life with a gut-wrenching sound. The lift shudders erratically as a massive creature claws its way up through one of the holes in the floor. It would appear this monstrosity resided on the underside of the lift, and you have awakened it!
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Colossal Tyrant enemy at the Great Lift. Choose an investigator at the Great Lift to test [agility] (3). If they succeed, exhaust the Colossal Tyrant.

flavor: Your only hope is to find the relic, if you can, and get out before the entire tower crumbles around you!
name: Escape the Tower (v.I)
text: [action] If you are at Twisting Catwalks: Resign. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (8 cards instead if there is only 1 investigator). Draw 1 [[Glyph]] card discarded by this effect. Then, one at a time, draw each [[Omen]] card discarded by this effect. Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.
back_flavor: You reach the topmost floor of the tower and search for any way to escape from the collapsing structure. The paths down are choked with rubble. The openings in the ceiling seem to be your only hope...

flavor: Your only hope is to find the relic, if you can, and get out before the entire tower crumbles around you!
name: Escape the Tower (v.II)
text: [action] If you are at East Antechamber: Resign. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (8 cards instead if there is only 1 investigator). Draw 1 [[Glyph]] card discarded by this effect. Then, one at a time, draw each [[Omen]] card discarded by this effect. Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.
back_flavor: You reach the bottom of this side of the tower and find a round dais that resembles some kind of door. As destruction rains down around you, the expedition members frantically press the glowing nodes and panels, hoping for a way out.

name: West Antechamber
text: [fast] During your turn, investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group (2 [per_investigator] clues instead if this location is flooded): Slide the Great Lift down once.
back_flavor: The once grand archway that opened out onto the streets of R'lyeh has long since collapsed, any hope of exit dashed by the choking rubble.

name: East Antechamber
text: [fast] During your turn, investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group (2 [per_investigator] clues instead if this location is flooded): Slide the Great Lift down once.
back_flavor: The floor of this chamber is dominated by a large circular slab covered in intricate alien carvings. Walking on its surface feels distinctly different than the other parts of the tower. The slab may cover a passage leading deeper into the city...

name: Twisting Catwalks
text: Forced - After an enemy at Twisting Catwalks deals damage and/or horror to you: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy at this location: Discard the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is that enemy's printed health. Draw 1 [[Glyph]] card discarded by this effect.
back_flavor: The overcast sky can be seen through holes in the ceiling above, casting dim light and dark shadows on the interlacing stone catwalks that make up the highest floor of this side of the tower.

name: Great Lift
text: Great Lift cannot move and is connected to the locations to the right and left of it, and vice versa. Forced - When the last clue is discovered from this location: Flip Great Lift (keeping all tokens and attachments).

name: Great Lift
text:
Great Lift is connected to the locations to the right and left of it, and vice versa.
[reaction]When you successfully investigate this location, instead of discovering clues: Slide Great Lift up or down once. You may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues to slide Great Lift up or down one additional time.

name: Ancient Altar
text: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to break the seal. This test gets -1 difficulty for every 5 glyphs the investigators have translated (to a max of -4). If you succeed, take control of the set-aside Shard of Y'ch'lecht story asset.
back_flavor: The stairway winding up the column is obstructed by gates, each one featuring a glowing alien symbol.
back_text:
You cannot enter this location unless there are 3 or more [[Glyph]] cards in the victory display.
As an additional cost to enter Ancient Altar, investigators at East Antechamber must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.

name: Ring Library
text: [reaction] When you discard 1 or more cards from the top of the encounter deck, choose and discard 1 card from your hand: Discard 2 additional cards from the top of the encounter deck. [action]: Move. Move to a revealed [[Passageway]] location.
back_flavor: The pathways wind and twist, making it impossible to navigate the crumbling structure. It would appear that the lift platform in the tower's center is the only way up or down.

name: Ring Library
text: [reaction] When you discard 1 or more cards from the top of the encounter deck, take 1 direct horror: Discard 3 additional cards from the top of the encounter deck.
back_flavor: The pathways wind and twist, making it impossible to navigate the crumbling structure. It would appear that the lift platform in the tower's center is the only way up or down.

name: Lofty Walkway
text: This location gets -1 shroud for each [[Glyph]] card in the victory display. Forced - When this location is revealed: Spawn the set-aside Star Spawn Observer at this location. [action]: Move. Move to a revealed [[Passageway]] location.
back_flavor: The pathways wind and twist, making it impossible to navigate the crumbling structure. It would appear that the lift platform in the tower's center is the only way up or down.

name: Lofty Walkway
text: Forced - After you discard 1 or more cards from the top of the encounter deck while at Lofty Walkway: The nearest ready, non-[[Elite]] enemy disengages from each investigator and moves to this location.
back_flavor: The pathways wind and twist, making it impossible to navigate the crumbling structure. It would appear that the lift platform in the tower's center is the only way up or down.

name: Luminous Archives
text: Luminous Archives gets +1 shroud for each [[Glyph]] card at or attached to it. [fast] Spend X actions (to a minimum of 1): Search the encounter discard pile for up to X [[Glyph]] cards and draw them, one at a time. [action]: Move. Move to a revealed [[Passageway]] location.
back_flavor: The pathways wind and twist, making it impossible to navigate the crumbling structure. It would appear that the lift platform in the tower's center is the only way up or down.

name: Luminous Archives
text: Forced - When the investigation phase ends, if there are clues on Luminous Archives: Shuffle each [[Glyph]] treachery attached to this location into the encounter deck. [action] [action]: Search the encounter discard pile for a [[Glyph]] card and draw it.
back_flavor: The pathways wind and twist, making it impossible to navigate the crumbling structure. It would appear that the lift platform in the tower's center is the only way up or down.

name: Court Keeper [tdc_rune_k]
text: If the investigators have translated 10 or more glyphs, this enemy gains relentless. Forced - When you defeat this enemy, discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_k] In your Campaign Log, record "Dreams" under [tdc_rune_k] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

name: Court Keeper [tdc_rune_j]
text: If the investigators have translated 10 or more glyphs, this enemy gains alert and retaliate. Forced - When you defeat this enemy, discover this glyph: [tdc_rune_j] In your Campaign Log, record "Sleep" under [tdc_rune_j] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_g]
text: Revelation - If this treachery is drawn from the encounter discard pile, attach it to your location. Otherwise, discard it and it gains surge. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, record "Life" under [tdc_rune_g] on the glyph record in your Campaign Log. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ancient Vault [tdc_rune_i]
text: Revelation - If this treachery is drawn from the encounter discard pile, attach it to your location. Otherwise, discard it and it gains surge. [action]: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, record "Cthulhu" under [tdc_rune_i] on the glyph record in your Campaign Log. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ruined Orrery [tdc_rune_h]
text: Revelation - If this treachery is drawn from the encounter discard pile, attach it to your location. Otherwise, discard it and it gains surge. [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, record "Y'ch'lecht" under [tdc_rune_h] on the glyph record in your Campaign Log. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Colossal Tyrant
text: Massive. Colossal Tyrant gets +3 [per_investigator] health and cannot move. Forced - When the enemy phase ends, if there are no investigators at Colossal Tyrant's location: Deal 1 direct horror to each card with sanity at each adjacent location.

name: Cosmic Omen
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If the investigators have translated 10 or more glyphs, this test gets +2 difficulty. If you fail, you must either shuffle one [[Glyph]] card in play into the encounter deck, or take 1 direct horror and discard 1 card at random from your hand.

name: Winged Keeper
text: Alert. Spawn - Highest level with no investigators. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Forced - When the enemy phase begins, if this enemy is ready and unengaged: It moves to its prey's location.

name: Shard of Y'ch'lecht
text:
You may ignore the first attack made against you by a [[Star Spawn]] or [[Deep One]] enemy each round.
[tdc_rune_b] · [tdc_rune_x] · [tdc_rune_o] · [tdc_rune_k]
[reaction] When a [[Star Spawn]] or [[Deep One]] enemy enters your location, exhaust this card: Exhaust that enemy.

name: Obsidian Canyons
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current Storm Intensity.
[cultist]: -4. If this test fails, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -1 for each open sky adjacent to your current location.
[elder_thing]: -2. If there is an enemy at your location, reveal another token.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 2 more than the current Storm Intensity.
[cultist]: -6. Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -2 for each open sky adjacent to your current location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If there is an enemy at your location, reveal another token.

flavor: Western gales howl with the fury of the cosmos.
name: Western Winds
text: Forced - When the round ends, reveal tokens from the chaos bag equal to the storm intensity. If a non-[elder_sign] symbol token is revealed: - Shuffle the rightmost open sky/[[Summit]] locations in rows 2 and 4 and place them on top of the Summit deck (or place them in the victory display instead if they have Victory X and no clues on them). Each enemy, token, and attachment at those locations/open sky are discarded. - Slide each open sky and [[Summit]] location in rows 2 and 4 once to the right. - Place the bottom card of the Summit deck in each gap created. - Flip this card.

flavor: A necrous wind blows from the eastern skies.
name: Eastern Winds
text: Forced - When the round ends, reveal tokens from the chaos bag equal to the storm intensity. If a non-[elder_sign] symbol token is revealed: - Shuffle the leftmost open sky/[[Summit]] locations in rows 1 and 3 and place them on top of the Summit deck (or place them in the victory display instead if they have Victory X and no clues on them). Each enemy, token, and attachment at those locations/open sky are discarded. - Slide each open sky and [[Summit]] location in rows 1 and 3 once to the left. - Place the bottom card of the Summit deck in each gap created. - Flip this card.

flavor: The clouds around R'lyeh crackle with alien energy as a storm picks up.
name: Otherworldly Storms
text: Each non-weakness enemy may enter or leave open sky as if it were a location. Each location is connected to each location (and open sky) adjacent to it. Forced - When an investigator's location would leave play: Move that investigator to any [[Central]] location. They take 2 direct damage.
back_flavor: There is more to this storm than just bad weather. As the gales howl around you, the alien landscape buckles and shifts before your very eyes, blurring your vision. When you regain focus, the skyline looks unfamiliar.
back_text:
If the current storm intensity is 6+, each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
Otherwise, add 1 resource to the current storm intensity.
Flip this agenda.

flavor: The clouds around R'lyeh crackle with alien energy as a storm picks up.
name: Encroaching Storms
text: Each non-weakness enemy may enter or leave open sky as if it were a location. Each location is connected to each location (and open sky) adjacent to it. Forced - When an investigator's location would leave play: Move that investigator to any [[Central]] location. They take 2 direct damage.
back_flavor: There is more to this storm than just bad weather. As the gales howl around you, the alien landscape buckles and shifts before your very eyes, blurring your vision. When you regain focus, the skyline looks unfamiliar.
back_text:
If the current storm intensity is 6+, each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
Otherwise, add 1 resource to the current storm intensity.
Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and spawn it at the lead investigator's location. If the current storm intensity is 3 or less, that enemy enters play exhausted and unengaged.
Flip this agenda.

flavor: The alien skyline calls to you, brimming with ancient secrets.
name: Searching the Spires
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator is at Central Spire, advance.
back_flavor: As you admire the skyline, you see the elephantine shape of a winged creature climbing up from below. You are being hunted.
back_text: Spawn the set-aside The Inescapable enemy at Central Spire, exhausted and unengaged. Shuffle the rest of The Inescapable encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Remove R'lyeh Streets from the game, ignoring its text box. Shuffle each open sky and [[Summit]] location in play except for Central Spire into the Summit deck. Each card and token at those locations is discarded. Put 5 of the set-aside open sky cards into play as shown in the Act 2 location placement diagram in the Campaign Guide (page 36). Fill each remaining row and column above, below, and to the right of Central Spire with the bottom card of the Summit deck until there are 3 rows and 5 columns. Shuffle the set-aside Ancient Dome and Aerial Waterfall locations, along with each remaining set-aside open sky card, into the top 5 cards of the Summit deck.

flavor: The alien skyline calls to you, brimming with ancient secrets.
name: To the Ancient Dome!
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.
back_flavor: The otherworldly clouds churn above the ever-shifting skyline, glimmering with alien shapes. Ruby hangs over the edge of a skyscraper, laughing devilishly. "Don't be scared! This is how you know you're alive!" she shouts. Whatever she says next is drowned out by the crack of thunder, and a quickening gale. Ruby throws the end of her line to you and pulls herself to the top.

flavor: The alien skyline calls to you, brimming with ancient secrets.
name: Scouring the Spires
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator is at Central Spire, advance.
back_flavor: At the tower's apex, you see R'lyeh in total. Some ancient calamity leveled the city, sending a shockwave so strong that the twisted spires are bent like blades of grass. What could have caused such great destruction?
back_text: Remove R'lyeh Streets from the game, ignoring its text box. Shuffle each open sky and [[Summit]] location in play except for Central Spire into the Summit deck. Each card and token at those locations is discarded. Put 5 of the set-aside open sky cards into play as shown in the Act 2 location placement diagram in the Campaign Guide (page 36). Fill each remaining row and column above, below, and to the right of Central Spire with the bottom card of the Summit deck until there are 3 rows and 5 columns. Shuffle the set-aside Floating Spire and Aerial Waterfall locations into the top 3 cards of the Summit deck.

flavor: A distant waterfall and gravity-defying spire beckon you onward.
name: Deadly Skies
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator is at Floating Spire, advance.
back_flavor: A shattered frieze depicts a large, clawed implement holding two broken shards of a tower together. A tool like that might be a worthwhile acquisition for Tillinghast.
back_text: Remove Central Spire from the game, ignoring its text box. Shuffle each open sky and [[Summit]] location in play aside from Floating Spire into the Summit deck. Each card and token at those locations is discarded. Put 5 of the set-aside open sky cards into play as shown in the Act 3 location placement diagram in the Campaign Guide (page 36). Fill each remaining row and column below and to the right of Floating Spire with the bottom card of the Summit deck until there are 4 rows and 5 columns. Shuffle the set-aside Western Wall location into the top 3 cards of the Summit deck.

flavor: You can recognize the western wall in the distance where you made landfall.
name: Return to the Shoreline
text: [action] Spend X clues: Reveal X cards from the bottom of the Summit deck. You may put 1 revealed location into play in an adjacent open sky and move to it. (Place that open sky card and each other revealed card on top of the Summit deck in any order.) Objective - If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.
back_flavor:
A tremor nearly knocks you loose as you descend the treacherous spires. After several tense minutes, you finally descend to the streets. Andy sits on a glistening boulder, doing his best not to look shaken. "Well. That's another half a dozen rolls of film gone," he sighs with a melancholy air. "At least we're back in one piece. Well, mostly," he laughs, favoring his bandaged arm.
After the rest of your group are gathered, you make your way back to the beach where you made landfall.

name: R'lyeh Streets
text: R'lyeh Streets cannot be moved or leave play. [action] Spend 1-3 resources: Place that many clues (from the token pool) on any revealed location (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor: Fetid seawater pools in the ancient streets, stinking of dead fish and rotten detritus. There is a funereal air in the sleeping city: a feeling of deep loss and dread.

name: Central Spire
text: Central Spire cannot be moved or leave play. [action] Spend 1-3 resources: Place that many clues (from the token pool) on any revealed location (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.
back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

name: Floating Spire
text: Floating Spire cannot be moved or leave play. [action] Spend 1-3 resources: Place that many clues (from the token pool) on any revealed location (Limit once per round.)

back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.
back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

name: Suspended Reef
text: Forced - After you end your turn at this location: You must either discard 1 card at random from your hand or take 1 damage. [fast] During your turn, spend 1 clue: Choose an enemy at a [[Summit]] location up to 3 connections away. Swap places with the chosen enemy, ignoring its location's Forced effect.
back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.
back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

If you fail, discard Hanging Ship (to the top of the Summit deck). [action] Each investigator at this location spends 1 clue: Slide Hanging Ship once into an adjacent open sky.
back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.
back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

name: Ancient Canyons
text: Forced - After you reveal this location: Test [agility] (1). If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Monster]] enemy and spawn it engaged with you. [action]: Put the set-aside Sky Relic [tdc_rune_f] asset into play under your control.
back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.
back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

text: Forced - After you reveal Dazzling Skyline: Take 1 horror. [action] Spend 1-3 clues: For each clue spent, reveal the bottom 3 cards of the Summit deck. You may place those cards on either the top or bottom of the Summit deck, in any order.
back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.

name: Aerial Waterfall
text: [fast] During your turn, spend 1 clue: Choose any revealed [[Summit]] location and move to it. (Limit once per round.) [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Put the set-aside Obsidian Claw story asset into play under control of any investigator, (Speed) side faceup.
back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.
back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

name: Magnetic Spires
text:
You cannot trigger abilities on [[Firearm]] assets while you are at Magnetic Spires.
[action] Each investigator at this location spends 1 clue: Choose an open sky up to 2 spaces away. Swap Magnetic Spires with the chosen open sky. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: The sprawling skyline is as beautiful as it is terrifying.
back_text: Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

name: Glyph Orrery [tdc_rune_d]
text: If Glyph Orrery [tdc_rune_d] would leave play, set it aside, out of play (or in the victory display if it has no clues on it). Forced - When you would enter this location, if you do not control the Obsidian Claw: You must either spend 1 clue or test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Flip this card.

flavor: A brilliant map of distant nebulae fills the room, bursting with color and light. A cerulean glob near the edge draws your attention. Staring at it fills your mind with a sharp, chittering alien language and the crash of waves. As you begin to mouth the strange language, a symbol glimmers in the cerulean sphere. Looking at it fills you with a deep yearning, an instinct to dive into deep underwater nests. Is this a word you learned, or an ancient, primordial memory recalled?
name: Glyph Orrery [tdc_rune_d]
text:
You discover this glyph:
[tdc_rune_d]
In your Campaign Log, record "Wave" under [tdc_rune_d] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated.
Flip this card back over to its location side. It cannot be flipped over again.

name: Sky Relic [tdc_rune_f]
text:
If Sky Relic [tdc_rune_f] would leave play, remove it from the game.
[action]: Test [agility] (8). Double the skill icons of each card committed to this skill test. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve its text.

flavor: Twisting a hidden knob in the relic's base releases a shower of sparks. You nearly drop the relic from surprise, but the "sparks" are merely random pinpricks of light and thick clouds of fog that shift like oil on water. The more you look at them, the more they resemble constellations, patterns of distant stars. The projection looks nothing like the constellations you've seen before, however.
name: Sky Relic [tdc_rune_f]
text:
You discover the following glyph:
[tdc_rune_f]
In your Campaign Log, record "Stars" under [tdc_rune_f] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e]
text: Revelation - Attach Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e] to your location. Cannot be canceled. If Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e] would leave play, set it aside, out of play. [action]: Test [combat] or [intellect] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage. Otherwise, put 1 resource on this card. If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e], flip it and resolve its text.

flavor: Parts of the frieze are worn smooth by the passage of time, but you eventually identify the shapes of mountains, clouds, mist. Within the mist, nightmarish shapes appear to be locked in some kind of struggle. Frightened creatures look up from below. Underneath it all, a cyclopean eye gazes intensely at an underground city deep below the surface. Heavy accenting depicts a roiling mist that fills the streets of the city. Each of the citizens reclines in a look of terrifying repose.
name: Eroded Frieze [tdc_rune_e]
text:
You discover this glyph:
[tdc_rune_e]
In your Campaign Log, record "Darkness" under [tdc_rune_e] on the glyph record. This glyph has been translated. Add this card to the victory display.

name: St. Elmo's Fire
text: Revelation - Attach St. Elmo's Fire to the nearest location without St. Elmo's Fire attached. Forced - When the round ends: Each investigator at this location takes 1 damage. Attach St. Elmo's Fire to an adjacent location (with investigators, if able).

flavor: You shouldn't have looked down.
name: Acrophobia
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each open sky adjacent to your location. For each point you fail by, you must either lose 1 action or take 1 horror.

name: Wings of Terror
text: Revelation - Put Wings of Terror into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Either draw that enemy, or that enemy attacks you (from the discard pile). Then, discard Wings of Terror.

name: Lost in the Clouds
text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Each investigator takes 2 direct horror. - Resolve the Forced effect on the Eastern Winds/Western Winds story card as if you had drawn a non-[elder_sign] symbol token.

name: Primeval Terror
text:
Patrol (nearest empty [[Summit]] location).
Cannot make attacks of opportunity.
While engaged with this enemy, you may enter open sky as if it were a location. If you defeat or disengage from this enemy while at open sky, you are defeated and suffer 1 physical trauma.

name: Star Vampire
text: Hunter. Relentless. Prey - Most remaining health. Forced - After this enemy attacks: Heal 1 damage from it.

name: Obsidian Claw
text: Cannot leave play. Enters play (Speed) side faceup. [fast] During your turn, exhaust this card and choose a location up to 2 connections away: Move to the chosen location. [tdc_rune_a] · [tdc_rune_p] · [tdc_rune_m] · [tdc_rune_e] · [tdc_rune_b] · [tdc_rune_c] [fast]: Flip this card. (Max once per round.)

name: Obsidian Claw
text: Cannot leave play. Enters play (Speed) side faceup. [action] Exhaust Obsidian Claw: Fight. You may use your [agility] instead of your [combat] and get +1 skill value for this attack. If the attacked enemy is exhausted, this attack deals +1 damage. [fast]: Flip this card. (Max once per round.)

name: Sepulchre of the Sleeper
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current Disturbance (to a maximum of 6).
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, draw the top card of the encounter deck. If you fail by 3 or more, that card gains peril and surge.
[tablet]: -4. For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or discard 1 card from your hand.
[elder_thing]: -3. Reveal another token.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the current Disturbance.
[cultist]: -6. If you fail, draw the top card of the encounter deck. If you fail by 3 or more, that card gains peril and surge.
[tablet]: -6. For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or discard 1 card from your hand.
[elder_thing]: -4. Reveal another token.

name: Beneath the City
text: Forced - When doom would be placed on a card other than a story asset: Place 1 resource on the scenario reference card, as Disturbance, instead. If the current Disturbance is 6 or more (8 or more instead of there are exactly 1 or 2 investigators in the game), immediately advance. Objective - Prepare your artifacts for the final showdown!

name: Cthulhu
text: Hunter. Massive. Relentless. Spawn - Dreamer's Rest. Forced - After Cthulhu is evaded: Either ready him, or each investigator at Cthulhu's location takes 1 direct damage.

name: Cthulhu Awakened
text: Forced - When doom is placed on this agenda: Each investigator takes 1 direct horror. [free] During your turn, remove 1 doom from an [[Artifact]] asset you control: Cthulhu loses relentless and gets -1 fight and -1 evade until the end of the round. (Limit once per asset per round.) Objective - If you manage to defeat Cthulhu: (→R1) (page 39)
back_flavor:
Against all odds, you have withstood the incredible and unstoppable tide that is Cthulhu, the ancient father or R'lyeh. Your tenacity has brought you to what you had hoped would be a stalemate.
But there is no stalemate against an ancient one.
back_text: Each surviving investigator is driven insane. Remove each of these investigators from your collection (wrap them in an oilcloth along with each of their signatures, put them in a sea chest, and drop that sea chest in the ocean at the following coordinates: 47°9'S 126°43'W).

flavor: There is something unsettling about the still black water.
name: Dreamer's Rest
text: Forced - After an investigator fails a test at this location: Place 1 resource on the scenario reference card, as Disturbance.
back_flavor: "In his house at R'lyeh, dead Cthulhu waits dreaming." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

name: Sigil-Carved Alcove
text: Forced - When Cthulhu enters this location: Each investigator discards 1 card at random from their hand. [action]: Test [willpower] (5). If you succeed, place 1 doom on Obsidian Claw. Investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to place 1 additional doom on Obsidian Claw.
back_flavor: "When the stars were right, They could plunge from world to world through the sky; but when the stars were wrong, They could not live." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

name: Sigil-Carved Alcove
text: Forced - When Cthulhu enters this location: Each investigator takes 1 direct damage. [action]: Test [combat] (5). If you succeed, place 1 doom on Barrier Node. Investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to place 1 additional doom on Barrier Node.
back_flavor: "When the stars were right, They could plunge from world to world through the sky; but when the stars were wrong, They could not live." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

name: Sigil-Carved Alcove
text: Forced - When Cthulhu enters this location: Each investigator takes 1 direct horror. [action]: Test [intellect] (5). If you succeed, place 1 doom on Tidal Tablet. Investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to place 1 additional doom on Tidal Tablet.
back_flavor: "When the stars were right, They could plunge from world to world through the sky; but when the stars were wrong, They could not live." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

name: Sigil-Carved Alcove
text: Forced - When Cthulhu enters this location: Each investigator loses 2 resources. [action]: Test [agility] (5). If you succeed, place 1 doom on Grisly "Mask". Investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to place 1 additional doom on Grisly "Mask".
back_flavor: "When the stars were right, They could plunge from world to world through the sky; but when the stars were wrong, They could not live." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

name: Sigil-Carved Alcove
text: Forced - When Cthulhu enters this location: Each investigator removes the top card of their deck from the game. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Place 1 doom on Shard of Y'ch'lecht. Investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to place 1 additional doom on Shard of Y'ch'lecht.
back_flavor: "When the stars were right, They could plunge from world to world through the sky; but when the stars were wrong, They could not live." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"

name: The Doom of Arkham Pt I
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of locations with no scenario cards beneath them (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If this test fails, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy with no doom on it.
[tablet]: -3. If this test fails, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. If your location is flooded, reveal another token.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of locations with no scenario cards beneath them.
[cultist]: -5. If this test fails, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy with no doom on it.
[tablet]: -5. If this test fails, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If your location is flooded, reveal another token.

flavor: The downpour worsens. As the streets begin to flood, terrifying creatures emerge from the shadows: creatures that could only have come from R'lyeh.
name: The Coming Storm
text: [action]: Resign. You give up your search. Forced - When doom is placed on this agenda: Increase the flood level of the lead investigator's location.
back_flavor: More and more unspeakable horrors rise out of the Miskatonic River. A strong current pulls you off your feet and carries you two blocks downstream. Grabbing a street lamp, you pull yourself to your feet as a tremor shakes the ground. Then another.
back_text: Each investigator who has not been eliminated immediately resigns.

flavor: Conflicting accounts place Tillinghast Esoterica in locations across Arkham.
name: The Phantom Shop
text: [action] Investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the top card beneath your location. If it is an asset, take control of it. Objective - When the round ends, if an investigator at Tillinghast Esoterica controls at least 1 [[Artifact]] asset, the investigators may advance. (Hint: Recover as many artifacts as possible!)
back_text:
If the investigators control 5 or more Artifact assets:
"I have worked too hard to see my plans undone," Randall seethes. Nightmarish shapes form around the antiquarian's head and shoulders as he grasps at you weakly. Pulse pounding, you run for the shop exit and barrel out into the street. When you turn to look, the shop door has vanished yet again.
(→R1) (page 46).
Otherwise:
"You're too late!" Randall wheezes, clutching his side. "The destruction of Arkham is at hand and you are powerless to stop it." Nightmarish shapes form around the antiquarian's head and shoulders as tchotchkes and ancient tomes fly off the shelves and hang suspended mid-air. Your vision blurs, then you find yourself back on the street. The shop has vanished yet again.
Each investigator earns 1 bonus experience. (→R2) (page 46).

name: Tillinghast Esoterica
text: Revelation - Put Tillinghast Esoterica into play adjacent to your location and spawn the set-aside Randall Tillinghast at it. Shuffle each set-aside [[Artifact]] asset and place them underneath it as a stack. Tillinghast Esoterica is connected to the location from which it was drawn, and vice versa. [free]: Place clues on this location up to its clue value.

flavor: "There is far more happening here than you could possibly comprehend."
name: Randall Tillinghast
text:
Relentless. Retaliate. 
Randall Tillinghast cannot move and gets +1 fight and +1[per_investigator] health for each card beneath Tillinghast Esoterica.

name: John Raymond Legrasse
text:
You get +1 skill value while fighting [[Deep One]] and [[Star Spawn]] enemies.
[reaction] During a skill test while fighting or evading Cthulhu, exhaust John Raymond Legrasse: You get +X skill value for this test, where X is Cthulhu's Rage.

name: Horror in Clay
text: Each [[Star Spawn]] enemy loses patrol and its printed Prey instructions and gains hunter and "Prey - You." [tdc_rune_u] · [tdc_rune_x] · [tdc_rune_o] · [tdc_rune_o] · [tdc_rune_d] · [tdc_rune_f] · [tdc_rune_z] [fast] Exhaust Horror in Clay: Either treat this asset's printed text box as if it were blank until the end of the round (except for Traits), or move a [[Star Spawn]] enemy once in any direction.

name: The Doom of Arkham Pt II
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is Cthulhu's Rage.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail and your location is flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, after this test resolves, draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck. (Max one draw per round.)
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 2 more than Cthulhu's Rage.
[cultist]: -5. If your location is flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -5. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -3. Reveal another token. If you fail, after this test resolves, draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck. (Max one draw per round.)

name: The Doom of Arkham
text: Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Increase the flood level of Cthulhu's location and draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck. Forced - When the round ends: Each investigator at a fully flooded location takes 1 damage/horror.
back_flavor: Floodwaters rise as Cthulhu and his denizens continue their assault. The fate of Arkham rests in your hands.
back_text: Move Cthulhu to the nearest fully flooded location that is not [[Ruined]] and decrease that location's flood level. Discard each clue and attachment at that location, and swap it with its set-aside [[Ruined]] version, unrevealed side faceup. If no location was swapped by this effect, draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck. If there are 7 [[Ruined]] locations in play, each investigator is killed. Otherwise, place clues on each revealed location without Victory X up to its clue value. Shuffle 1 set-aside [[Star Spawn]] enemy into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Flip this agenda.

flavor: With the others at your side, you must make a final stand to save Arkham!
name: Fight Back!
text: [free] During an attack at your location, spend 1 clue: That attack deals +1 damage. (Max once per attack.) Objective - When the round ends, if there are 3 [[Cthulhu]] enemies in the victory display, advance.
back_flavor: The ancient menace continues his rampage. Your attempts to draw his attention appear to be working. Perhaps if you hold out long enough, you can drive him out of Arkham... if only for now.
back_text: Return each [[Cthulhu]] enemy in the victory display to its place on the Cthulhu Board, non-[[Enraged]] side faceup. Increase Cthulhu's Rage by 1. If Cthulhu's Rage is 4 or less, flip back to act 1a. Otherwise, if Cthulhu's Rage is 5 or more, (→R1).

flavor: By drawing Cthulhu's anger, you and your allies may be able to devise a way to seal the ancient one away!
name: Banish Him!
text: [free] During an attack at your location, spend 1 clue: That attack deals +1 damage. (Max once per attack.) Objective - When the round ends, if there are 3 [[Cthulhu]] enemies in the victory display, advance.
back_flavor: The ancient menace continues his rampage. Your attempts to draw his attention appear to be working. Hopefully, you've bought Andy enough time to find a way to seal the ancient one away.
back_text: Return each [[Cthulhu]] enemy in the victory display to its place on the Cthulhu Board, non-[[Enraged]] side faceup. Increase Cthulhu's Rage by 1. If Cthulhu's Rage is 3 or less, flip back to act 1a. Otherwise, if Cthulhu's Rage is 4 or more: - Set Cthulhu's Rage to 5 (4 instead if there are 1 or 2 investigators). Flip each [[Cthulhu]] enemy to its [[Enraged]] side, ignoring its Forced effect. - Place clues on each revealed location without Victory X up to its clue value. - In player order, each investigator may take control of 1 set-aside [[Ally]] story asset. They do not take up an ally slot for the remainder of this scenario. - Advance the act and agenda deck to The Final Seal special agenda and place 1 [per_investigator] doom on it. It is both the current act and the current agenda.

name: The Final Seal
text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, and place an [[Artifact]] asset you control in the victory display: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on your location, as a sigil. Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck. Objective - Banish the awakened dreamer! If each [[Cthulhu]] enemy is in the victory display and there are 5 locations with sigils on them, immediately advance.
back_flavor:
A quickening gale stirs the black water at Cthulhu's sagging legs. As glowing green sigils alight on the awful dead god's arms and legs, he looses an ear-splitting roar that shatters windows and shakes the very foundations of the city. Hunched over nearby, Andy intones a string of guttural words, holding one shaking hand over a glowing artifact. "It's working!" Ruby shouts.
Another roar. The sound of gunfire echoes across the water as the Arkham police try in vain to draw his attention. You look up to see the ancient one himself staring down at you, his eyes glowing a vivid crimson. The behemoth raises one clawed hand overhead to crush you like an insect.
back_text: If this agenda advanced by reaching its doom threshold, each investigator is defeated. Otherwise, if there are 5 or fewer [[Ruined]] locations in play, (→R2) (page 50). Otherwise, (→R3) (page 51).

name: Northside
text:
Northside cannot be fully flooded.
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, reveal the top 3 cards of the Cthulhu deck. You may discard 1 of them and place the rest back on top in any order. (Group limit once per round.)
back_flavor: Wrecked trains are scattered and askew on the tracks like a child's toys. A handful of factory workers emerge, dazed and frightened, to look up at the hulking form destroying their home.
back_text: Northside cannot be fully flooded.

flavor: A few socialites and club-goers stagger through the flooded streets, seemingly lost in dreams.
name: Downtown
text: [reaction] When a [[Star Spawn]] enemy enters Downtown, spend 3 resources: Automatically evade that enemy.
back_flavor: The rising fog lends the once-bustling streets an eerie calm. Behind closed doors, citizens lie in unnatural slumber, oblivious to the destruction unfolding outside.

name: Easttown
text:
Easttown cannot be fully flooded.
[action] Discard an [[Ally]] asset you control: Decrease this location's flood level and draw 3 cards. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: Easttown is filled with the sound of hungry flames and the cries of the injured and the dying.
back_text: Easttown cannot be fully flooded.

name: Miskatonic University
text:
Miskatonic University cannot be fully flooded.
[action] Choose and discard up to 3 cards with [intellect] icons from your hand: For each card discarded in this way, heal 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at Miskatonic University. (Limit once per game.)
back_flavor: Dark water invades every corner of the prestigious institution, drowning out decades of research and ruining countless precious tomes.
back_text: Miskatonic University cannot be fully flooded.

name: Rivertown
text: [action]: Test [agility] (3) or [intellect] (3) to attempt to open the emergency drain. If you succeed, decrease the flood level of this or an adjacent location. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: The docks along the river have been completely swept away. Only flooded warehouses and abandoned shops remain.

name: St. Mary's Hospital
text:
St. Mary's Hospital cannot be fully flooded.
[reaction] After Cthulhu enters St. Mary's Hospital: Place up to 3 of your clues on this location. For each clue placed in this way, deal 1 damage to an enemy at this location. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: The raging fires threaten the hundreds of ailing patients in St. Mary's eastern ward. The few brave nurses and doctors who have not succumbed to the strange sleeping sickness work through the night to keep their patients safe.
back_text: St. Mary's Hospital cannot be fully flooded.

flavor: The old family homes of Southside have been reduced to splinters.
name: Southside
text: [action] Choose an [[Item]] asset in your discard pile and add it to your hand. (Group limit once per game.)
back_flavor: The neighborhood's dense infrastructure makes it an easy target. Burning buildings cast flickering shadows on the flooded streets.

name: Western Rooftops
text:
Western Rooftops cannot be flooded and sigils cannot be placed on it.
Northside, Miskatonic University, and St. Mary's Hospital are connected to Western Rooftops, and vice versa.
While you are at Western Rooftops, you may fight and evade enemies at connecting locations as if you were at their location.
back_text:
As an additional cost to enter Western Rooftops, you must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Western Rooftops cannot be flooded.
Northside, Miskatonic University, and St. Mary's Hospital are connected to Western Rooftops, and vice versa.

name: Eastern Rooftops
text:
Eastern Rooftops cannot be flooded and sigils cannot be placed on it.
Easttown, Rivertown, and Southside are connected to Eastern Rooftops, and vice versa.
While you are at Eastern Rooftops, you may fight and evade enemies at connecting locations as if you were at their location.
back_text:
As an additional cost to enter Eastern Rooftops, you must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Eastern Rooftops cannot be flooded.
Easttown, Rivertown, and Southside are connected to Eastern Rooftops, and vice versa.

name: Cthulhu
text:
Each [[Cthulhu]] enemy on the Cthulhu Board shares this enemy's [[Traits]], text box, and location.
Massive. Patrol (nearest location that can be flooded). Cannot make attacks of opportunity.

name: Cthulhu
text: Alert. Prey - Highest [agility]. X is Cthulhu's Rage. Cannot be damaged, defeated, or exhausted. [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Flip it to its [[Enraged]] side.

name: Cthulhu
text: Alert. Prey - Highest [agility]. X is Cthulhu's Rage. Cannot be exhausted. Forced - After you flip this enemy to this side: Draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck. [reaction] After you evade this enemy: Deal 1 damage to it.

name: Cthulhu
text: Alert. Retaliate. Prey - Highest [willpower]. X is Cthulhu's Rage. Cannot be damaged, defeated, or exhausted. [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Flip it to its [[Enraged]] side.

name: Cthulhu
text: Alert. Retaliate. Prey - Highest [willpower]. X is Cthulhu's Rage. Cannot be exhausted. Forced - After you flip this enemy to this side: Discard 1 card at random from your hand. [reaction] After you evade this enemy: Deal 1 damage to it.

name: Cthulhu
text: Retaliate. Prey - Highest [combat]. X is Cthulhu's Rage. Cannot be damaged, defeated, or exhausted. [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Flip it to its [[Enraged]] side.

name: Cthulhu
text: Retaliate. Prey - Highest [combat]. X is Cthulhu's Rage. Cannot be exhausted. Forced - After you flip this enemy to this side: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] After you evade this enemy: Deal 1 damage to it.

name: Ruthless Charge
text: If Cthulhu (Hoary Wings) is in play: Each investigator at Cthulhu's location discards one card from hand at random. If Cthulhu (Fierce Visage) is in play: Cthulhu (Fierce Visage) attacks the investigator with the highest [willpower] at Chulhu's location. If no attack was made, the investigator with the highest [willpower] draws the top card of the encounter deck. That card's effects cannot be canceled and it loses surge. If Cthulhu (Wicked Claw) is in play: The investigator with the highest [combat] at Cthulhu's location must test [combat] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If they fail, Cthulhu (Wicked Claw) attacks them.

name: Hurricane Force
text: If Cthulhu (Hoary Wings) is in play: Resolve Cthulhu's patrol keyword an additional time. If Cthulhu (Fierce Visage) is in play: The nearest investigator to Cthulhu must test [willpower] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If that investigator fails, Cthulhu (Fierce Visage) attacks them. If Cthulhu (Wicked Claw) is in play: Choose an investigator at Cthulhu's location to test [agility] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If that investigator fails, they must either increase the flood level of Cthulhu's location, or take 1 damage or 1 horror.

name: Dire Gale
text: If Cthulhu (Hoary Wings) is in play: Each investigator at Cthulhu's location discards 1 card at random from hand. Resolve Cthulhu's patrol keyword an additional time. If Cthulhu (Fierce Visage) is in play: The investigator with the highest [willpower] tests [willpower] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If they fail, they must either take 1 horror, or choose and discard a non-story asset they control. If Cthulhu (Wicked Claw) is in play: If Cthulhu did not move via his patrol keyword this round, Cthulhu (Wicked Claw) attacks each investigator at its location.

name: Dreadsight
text: If Cthulhu (Hoary Wings) is in play: The investigator with the highest [agility] tests [agility] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If they fail, they take 1 damage or 1 horror. If Cthulhu (Fierce Visage) is in play: Each investigator at Cthulhu's location loses 2 resources. If Cthulhu (Wicked Claw) is in play: The investigators must decide, as a group: - Each investigator loses 1 action during their next turn. - Cthulhu (Wicked Claw) attacks each investigator at its location. - Each investigator takes 1 direct horror.

name: Demolition
text: Place 1 damage token on the [[Rooftop]] location nearest to Cthulhu, as a ruin token. If there are 2 or more ruin tokens on that location,each investigator is killed and each enemy at that location is discarded. Then, remove that location and this card from the game. Otherwise, shuffle this card into the Cthulhu deck along with the Cthulhu discard pile.

name: Fifth Eye
text: Put this card into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Place 1 doom on an enemy on the Cthulhu Board with no doom on it and discard this card.

name: Seismic Stomp
text:
If there are no investigators at Cthulhu's location, discard this card and draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck.
Otherwise, each investigator at Cthulhu's location tests [agility] or [willpower] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If they fail, they must either take 1 damage/horror, or discard 1 card from their hand at random.

name: Eldritch Call
text:
If there are no investigators at Cthulhu's location, discard this card and draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck.
Otherwise, each investigator at Cthulhu's location tests [willpower] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If 1 or more investigators fail, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and spawn it at Cthulhu's location.

name: Psychic Rebuke
text:
If there are no [[Cthulhu]] enemies in the victory display, discard this card and draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck.
Otherwise, choose an investigator to test [willpower] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If they fail, choose a [[Cthulhu]] enemy in the victory display and return it to the Cthulhu board, [[Enraged]] side faceup.

name: Rising Tides
text:
Decrease the flood level of Cthulhu's location and choose another location (with an investigator, if able) that can have its flood level increased. Increase the flood level of the chosen location.
Each investigator at a fully flooded location tests [agility] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If they fail, they must either take 1 damage or discard a non-story asset they control.

name: Hope Fades
text: Put this card into play next to the agenda deck. Search the chaos bag and all in- and out-of-play areas for the [elder_sign] token and seal it on this card. (If you cannot, search the chaos bag for the numbered token with the highest positive value and seal it on this card instead.) Forced - When the act advances: Discard this card (release the token sealed here).

flavor: Arkham will never be the same. The ancient creature tosses trees, houses, and vehicles aside as if they were made of paper.
name: Lay Waste
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If you fail, take 2 damage.

flavor: [tdc_rune_m] · [tdc_rune_l][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_k] · [tdc_rune_h][tdc_rune_x][tdc_rune_n] · [tdc_rune_g][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_b] · [tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_h] · [tdc_rune_z][tdc_rune_s][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_f][tdc_rune_e] · [tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_h][tdc_rune_k]
name: Eyes of Y'ch'lecht
text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If you fail, take 1 direct horror and discard 1 card at random from your hand.

name: Gross Plasticity
text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the agenda to advance. - Increase the flood level of your location. - Each investigator takes 1 damage or 1 horror.

flavor: [tdc_rune_l][tdc_rune_n][tdc_rune_j][tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_c] · [tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_x] · [tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_h] · [tdc_rune_g][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_p][tdc_rune_p] · [tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_s][tdc_rune_k] · [tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_l] · [tdc_rune_f][tdc_rune_x] · [tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_l][tdc_rune_u][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_q][tdc_rune_k]
name: Arkham Under Assault
text: Revelation - Each investigator tests [willpower] (X), where X is Cthulhu's Rage. If 1 or more investigators fail, draw the top card of the Cthulhu deck.

name: Stowaway Drone
text: Aloof. Patrol (nearest other enemy with no doom on it ). Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Place 1 doom on another non-[[Elite]] enemy at this location. Then, discard Stowaway Drone.

name: Infected!
text: Revelation - Put Infected! into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - After you end your turn at a location with another investigator or a [[Stowaway]] enemy: Place 1 doom on Infected! [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage. If you succeed, discard Infected!

flavor: "…the Great Old Ones spoke to the sensitive among them by moulding their dreams." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Pilgrim Acolyte
text: Forced - After Pilgrim Acolyte attacks: Place 1 doom on it.

name: Pilgrim Leader
text: Aloof. Spawn - Any location (empty, if able). While Pilgrim Leader is ready, each other [[Cultist]] enemy gets +2 fight and gains hunter and relentless.

name: Monstrous Star Spawn
text: Hunter. Massive. Relentless. Prey - Highest [combat]. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while fighting or evading this enemy: Heal 1 damage from it.

name: Infected Star Spawn
text: Hunter. Relentless. Prey - Highest [agility]. Forced - The first time this enemy would be defeated: Heal all damage from it and ready it. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while fighting or evading Infected Star Spawn: Take 1 horror.

name: Coral Star Spawn
text: Hunter. Relentless. Prey - Highest [willpower]. While Coral Star Spawn has damage on it, it gains alert and retaliate. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while fighting or evading this enemy: Take 1 damage.

name: Star Spawn Observer
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Highest [intellect]. Forced - When you reveal an [elder_thing] token while investigating Star Spawn Observer's location: It engages you and makes an immediate attack.

name: Eye of the Deep
text: Revelation - Put Eye of the Deep into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Treat each [cultist] and [tablet] token you reveal during a skill test as if it were an [elder_thing] token, instead. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Eye of the Deep.

name: Cunning Mimicry
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Monster]] enemies in play, Cunning Mimicry gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] (3). If you fail, the nearest [[Monster]] enemy attacks you (regardless of its current location).

name: Elder Mist
text: Revelation - Attach Elder Mist to the nearest location without Elder Mist attached. Each investigator at attached location gets -1 [willpower], -1 [intellect],-1 [combat], and -1 [agility]. Forced - After an investigator at attached location succeeds at a skill test by 2 or more: Discard Elder Mist.

name: Corrosive Fog
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] or [combat] (4). If you fail, take 1 damage. If you fail by 3 or more, instead deal 1 direct damage to your investigator and each [[Ally]] and [[Item]] asset you control with health.

name: Voltaic Eel
text: Hunter. Prey - Most clues. While Voltaic Eel is moving during the enemy phase, each fully flooded location is considered to be connected to one another.

name: Dreaming Migration
text: Revelation - If there are no enemies in play, Dreaming Migration gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must choose one: - The nearest enemy moves to your location and makes an immediate attack. - Draw the topmost enemy in the encounter discard pile.

name: Undersea Hunt
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +2 difficulty if your location is fully flooded. If you fail, take 1 damage and increase the flood level of the nearest eligible location.

name: Deadly Torrent
text: Revelation - If your location is unflooded, Deadly Torrent gains surge. Otherwise, you must choose: - Test [agility] (4) to swim to safety. If you succeed, move to a connecting location. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror. - Test [combat] (4) to stand your ground. If you fail, take 1 damage and discard 1 asset you control that takes up 1 or more slots.

flavor: "I cannot think of the deep sea without shuddering at the nameless things that may at this very moment be crawling and floundering on its slimy bed..." - H.P. Lovecraft, "Dagon"
name: Something in the Water
text: Surge. Revelation - Increase the flood level of the nearest eligible location.

name: Ominous Silence
text: Revelation - Put Ominous Silence into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to play a card, you must either spend 1 resource or take 1 horror. [action]: Test [agility] (3). If your location is not flooded, this test automatically succeeds. If you succeed, discard Ominous Silence.

flavor: "He had an unprecedented dream of great Cyclopean cities of titan blocks and sky-flung monoliths..." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Cyclopean Architecture
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (X), where X is your location's printed shroud. For each point you fail by, choose and discard 1 card from your hand (to a maximum of 3).

flavor: "He said that the geometry of the dream-place he saw was abnormal, non-Euclidean, and loathsomely redolent of spheres and dimensions apart from ours." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Crumbling Masonry
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (X), where X is your location's printed shroud. If you fail, take 2 damage.

flavor: [tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_f] · [tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_l] · [tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_x][tdc_rune_n][tdc_rune_l][tdc_rune_k] · [tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_c] · [tdc_rune_s][tdc_rune_p][tdc_rune_h][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_b] · [tdc_rune_z][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_z] · [tdc_rune_u][tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_n][tdc_rune_p][tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_n] · [tdc_rune_g][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_c][tdc_rune_l] · [tdc_rune_z][tdc_rune_s][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_f][tdc_rune_e]
name: "Cthulhu fhtagn!"
text: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, you must either take 2 horror or deal 1 direct damage to an investigator at your location.

flavor: "I have looked upon all the universe has to hold of horror, and even the skies of spring and flowers of summer must ever afterward be poison to me." - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"
name: Oppressive Influence
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is your location's printed shroud. If you fail, take 2 horror.

name: Domination
text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Each investigator discards 2 cards from their hand. - Each investigator loses 1 action.

name: The Inescapable
text: Hunter. Relentless. Spawn - Any connecting location (empty, if able). Forced - The first time each round an [elder_thing] token is revealed from the chaos bag: Ready The Inescapable and resolve its hunter keyword (it does not attack).

name: Still Behind You
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each copy of Still Behind You in the victory display. If you fail and The Inescapable... - ...is in play, it moves, one location at a time, to your location and engages you. - ...is not in play, search all in- and out-of-play areas for The Inescapable and draw it. Add Still Behind You in the victory display.

flavor: A hunter perfectly adapted to the lightless deep.
name: Deep One Thrall
text: Forced - After Deep One Thrall engages you: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

name: Elder Deep One
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Each other [[Deep One]] enemy gains relentless. Forced - After Elder Deep One engages you: Heal 1 damage from each other [[Deep One]] enemy in play.

flavor: "Be careful out there. We have no idea what's lurking in the shadows."
name: Deep One Ambush
text: Revelation - Put Deep One Ambush into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - After a [[Deep One]] enemy engages you: It attacks you. Then, discard Deep One Ambush.

flavor: [tdc_rune_g][tdc_rune_b][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_c] · [tdc_rune_z][tdc_rune_x] · [tdc_rune_h][tdc_rune_x][tdc_rune_n] · [tdc_rune_z][tdc_rune_s][tdc_rune_k][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_o] · [tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_f] · [tdc_rune_h][tdc_rune_x][tdc_rune_n][tdc_rune_s] · [tdc_rune_l][tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_d][tdc_rune_p][tdc_rune_p] · [tdc_rune_o][tdc_rune_m][tdc_rune_f][tdc_rune_z]
name: Tortured Visions
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +2 difficulty if you have 3 or fewer cards in your hand. If you fail, take 1 direct horror and discard 1 card at random from your hand.

name: Drawn to Darkness
text: Revelation - Put Drawn to Darkness into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Your maximum hand size is reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 1). Forced - When your turn ends, if you have no cards in hand: Discard Drawn to Darkness.

name: Persistent Construct
text: Hunter. Prey - Nearest investigator with an [[Artifact]] asset. Forced - When you defeat this enemy: Spawn each other Persistent Construct in the victory display, exhausted, at your location.

name: Infernal Machinery
text: Revelation - Put Infernal Machinery into play in your threat area. You cannot trigger abilities on [[Glyph]] or [[Artifact]] cards. [action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, discard Infernal Machinery.

name: No Place Like Home
text: Permanent. Uses (8 discoveries). Forced - When you reveal a location or put a location into play: Remove 1 discovery from No Place Like Home. Forced - When the game ends, if there are 1 [per_investigator] or fewer discoveries on No Place Like Home: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: No Place Like Home
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You may take an additional action during your turn, which may only be used to move.

name: Walk in Faith
text: Permanent. Uses (0 signs). [reaction] After an [elder_sign] token is revealed at any location: Place 1 sign on Walk in Faith. Forced - When the game ends, if there are more than 1 [per_investigator] signs on Walk in Faith: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Walk in Faith
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After an [elder_sign] token is revealed at any location: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at that location.

name: Toe the Line
text: Permanent. Forced - When you take 1 or more damage: Place 1 damage on Toe the Line as well. Forced - When the game ends, if the amount of damage on this card equals or exceeds your maximum health: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Toe the Line
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [combat] and +2 maximum health.

name: Good Money
text: Permanent. [reaction] When you gain 1 or more resources: Place 1 of those resources on Good Money. Forced - When the game ends, if there are 5 or more resources on Good Money: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Good Money
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You begin the game with 5 additional resources.

name: Prove Your Worth
text: Permanent. Uses (4 chances). Forced - After you fail a skill test by 2 or more: Remove 1 chance from Prove Your Worth. Forced - When the game ends, if there are 1 or more chances on Prove Your Worth: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Prove Your Worth
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
Uses (3 chances).
[reaction] When a non-[auto_fail] token is revealed during a skill test at your location, spend 1 chance: Cancel that token.

name: Do No Harm
text: Permanent. Uses (5 obligations). [reaction] After you heal damage/horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset: Remove 1 obligation from Do No Harm. Forced - When the game ends, if there are no obligations on Do No Harm: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Do No Harm
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you heal damage/horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset, exhaust Do No Harm: Gain 1 resource.

name: Dreams of Destruction
text: Permanent. Forced - When you take 1 or more horror: Place 1 horror on Dreams of Destruction as well. Forced - When the game ends, if the amount of horror on this card equals or exceeds your maximum sanity: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Dreams of Destruction
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You have 1 additional arcane slot and get +2 maximum sanity.

name: Plumb the Depths
text: Permanent. Uses (5 obsessions). Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue at your location: Remove 1 obsession from Plumb the Depths. Forced - When the game ends, if there are no obsessions on Plumb the Depths: In your Campaign Log, mark 1 progress under this Task.

name: Plumb the Depths
text:
Permanent. Unless this task has been completed, it enters play with its weakness side faceup.
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you discover the last clue at your location, exhaust Plumb the Depths: Draw 1 card.

name: Expedition Gear
text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage from an investigator at your location.
[fast] Remove Expedition Gear from the game: Move a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or a connecting location once in any direction.

name: Laudanum
text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location.
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness [[Power]] or [[Terror]] treachery, remove Laudanum from the game: Cancel that treachery's revelation effect and discard it.

name: Alien Tablet
text:
Uses (4 secrets).
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Glyph]] or [[R'lyeh]] card, exhaust Alien Tablet and spend 1 secret: The performing investigator gets +2 skill value for this skill test.

name: Diving Suit
text: If your location is fully flooded, you may treat it as if it were partially flooded for the purposes of card effects. Forced - When any amount of damage would be placed on you: Place 1 of that damage on Diving Suit.

flavor: "Life's just one big score, and I plan to be the winner."
name: Ruby Standish
text:
You get +1 [agility].
[fast] If there are no ready enemies at your location, exhaust Ruby Standish: Move to a connecting location.

flavor: "I thought this story was gonna go in a very different direction."
name: Andy Van Nortwick
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
If your location has no clues on it, ignore the first attack of opportunity made against you each round.
